GameItemType.Description: A young father travelled many miles searching for a compassionate healer to save his dying son. He arrived to find the healer murdered by bandits. But in the grip of that corpse's hand awaited one of these swords of vengeance.
Your foes may laugh at this simple wood shield. But the oak branch from which it was carved stands hard as rock, and the magic within it can defeat death itself.

GameModifier.Provides: Shield Bash- Knocks the victim back a tile
Unlocks Death Ward: If this unit is killed in battle they are resurrected with half their hit points. This enchantment lasts for 5 actions or until the unit is resurrected.

GameItemType.Description: This seed contains the enduring spirit of life itself, which even cataclysm itself could not eradicate. Plant it where you would wish to see life return to the land.

GameModifier.Provides: A new crop will spring up wherever you plant this seed.

GameItemType.Description: This seed contains the enduring spirit of life itself, which even cataclysm itself could not eradicate.

GameModifier.Provides: A new crop will spring up wherever you plant this seed.

GameItemType.Description: Despite the smell of seaweed, this belt glows beautifully and shows no flaws. Its wearer has his strength imbued, and moves swiftly, as if bolstered by an invisible undertoe.

GameItemTypes.GameItemType:
Tome of the Tide Kingdoms This book contains the secrets of the undersea peoples, their history with channeling and their fight to survive the Cataclysm. Any who read it shall understand Elemental in a whole new way. 90
Unit GiveExperience 500 +500 Experience
0 -1 Unique 1
0
TomeoftheWaves_ArtDef>

GameItemType.Description: This well-crafted blade cannot be heated, instead sucking the warmth from the air around it. If your enemies survive its slashes, the frostbite will keep them down.
No door, chest, or window made of any earthly material can remain sealed once this key is placed within its lock.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in

GameItemType.Description: Only the stoutest can keep this heavy shield aloft in combat, but the protection against blow and spell it provides is worth the strain.

GameModifier.Provides: Shield Bash- Knocks the victim back a tile

GameItemType.Description: This plate breastpiece is unmatched in its durability against sword and spell, yet weighs nearly nothing. When worn, its plates grow or shrink to fit the user. Thus even those normally paralyzed by armor to wear this cuirass comfortably.
Few occurrences anger the mountains. But all their brewing hatred for wind, rain and pickaxe has coalesced into this weapon.

GameModifier.Provides: Bash- Has a chance equal to the damage done of knocking the victim prone
Crushing Blow- +100% Attack, but you lose your next action

GameItemType.Description: Though not as potent as the legendary Pyre Brand, this sword still burns hot enough to kill almost anything alive.
These gauntlets contain the raw power of a volcanic eruption within. Hope you are not wearing them, should the enchantment ever fail.
It's hard to say which is worse, the heat it exudes or the terrible cut of its blade. Together they make this weapon legendary in its killing ability.

GameModifier.Provides: Backswing- If the attack misses the unit gets a second attack against the same target

GameItemType.Description: This sword has been found and discarded by dozens of mighty warriors. The blade seems to be brittle dry bone. Yet when drenched in fresh blood, its grows stronger, sharper and magically deadlier.
Those who wear this cloak command the power of night, making them difficult to hit and imbuing their attacks with a deadly magical darkness.
Impossibly light yet sturdy, this bow draws with airy ease, and strikes with the force of a hurricane.
If there were a deity of Thunder, he or she would swing a hammer like this one.

GameModifier.Provides: Bash- Has a chance equal to the damage done of knocking the victim prone
Crushing Blow- +50% Attack, but you lose your next action

GameItemType.Description: Learn to play a simple melody on this instrument, and winds shall become your mightiest weapon.

GameModifier.Provides: All enemies lose their next turn unless they resist. Doing this destroys the flute.

GameItemType.Description: This jug allows units to, once per battle, either toss molotov coktails, or units with bows can light a section of the battle on fire.

GameModifier.Provides: Allows troops to light tiles on fire in combat, once per battle.
Once per battle this unit can toss a molotov cocktail (costs 30 gold).
If the unit is an archer, they can launch a burning arrow volley instead.

GameItemType.Description: These coins, lighter than air, confer faster reaction.
This tiny anvil will slow down your troops, but give them unnatural resilience.
If your troops can endure the pain of carrying these explosive pebbles, they'll unleash fire upon their foes.
Carrying a jug of this blessed seawater makes the bearer flow in battle, bending and parting where they instead might have otherwise broken.
If your troops are eating this fruit as they march, their performance in battle will be far heartier.
Holding this stone drains away the bearer's vitality, but they will fight as if possessed by death itself.
